content:
5.16. 
Invalidity of a will or parts thereof
1. A will shall not be valid:
1) made by a person who is incapacitated in this field;
2. made by a person with limited capacity;
3. the contents of which are unlawful or incomprehensible.
2. A will may also be declared void on other grounds of invalidity.
3. A will which has not survived shall have no effect. The contents of such a will cannot be determined by a court.
4. The testator may not delegate to another person after the death of the testator the determination or modification of the contents of the will.
